notable_quotes.speaker: Laurence femme Vincent Bandesapt
notable_quotes.french: que toutte sa vie, elle a prins peine de bien faire, servir a Dieu, et faire des aulmosnes, et neantmoins elle veoit presentment elle est accusée pour sorciere, jacois qu'elle est femme de bien, que sy on informoit contre la vierge Marie on y trouveroit a redire
notable_quotes.english: that all her life, she has taken pains to do good, serve God, and give alms, and nevertheless she now sees she is accused of being a witch, although she is a good woman, that if one investigated the Virgin Mary one would find fault
notable_quotes.context: During confrontation with Marguitte Haxo, November 2, 1611

notable_quotes.speaker: Laurence femme Vincent Bandesapt
notable_quotes.french: qu'elle nous prie par l'honneur de Dieu d'envoyer appeller son marit pour luy encore parler une fois pour la derniere, et que par apres elle nous dira tout ce qu'elle se sentira coulpable, et dela qu'on la mene tout droit au supplice
notable_quotes.english: that she begs us by the honor of God to send for her husband so she can speak to him one last time, and afterwards she will tell us everything she feels guilty of, and then let her be led straight to execution

notable_quotes.speaker: Laurence femme Vincent Bandesapt
notable_quotes.french: et que comme elle a entendu dire que ceulx qui sont sorciers et sorcieres, et meurent sans en avoir faict confession à la justice, et en enduré la peine du feu, sy tant estoit que sa feue mere soit esté sorciere, elle est contante d'estre bruslée au nom d'icelle, pour sauver son ame
notable_quotes.english: and as she has heard it said that those who are sorcerers and witches, and die without having confessed to the justice, and endured the punishment of fire, if it were the case that her late mother was a witch, she is content to be burned in her name, to save her soul
notable_quotes.context: During interrogation about her mother's reputation, November 9, 1611

notable_quotes.speaker: Laurence femme Vincent Bandesapt
notable_quotes.french: qu'elle voudroit de bonne volonté luy en avoir fait
notable_quotes.english: that she would gladly have done her harm
notable_quotes.context: About her niece Catherine Bandeca during interrogation, November 9, 1611

notable_quotes.speaker: Catherine femme Jean des Mailles de Raon (via Laurence's sister-in-law)
notable_quotes.french: qu'elle les yroit veoir le grand diable qui les emporteroit
notable_quotes.english: that she would go see them, the great devil who would carry them away
notable_quotes.context: Laurence's alleged response when asked to visit sick neighbors, about 25 years before

notable_quotes.speaker: Monsieur d'Epinal
notable_quotes.french: qu'elle en pourroit bien tant faire qu'on la feroit prendre et brusler
notable_quotes.english: that she might well do so much that they would have her taken and burned
notable_quotes.context: Response when Jacquot Charpentier told him about Laurence's threats

extraction_metadata.notes: Trial record is complete with comprehensive witness testimony, confession under torture, and clear timeline. Economic status assessed as 'middling' based on husband's occupation as locksmith, ownership of property (chest, clothes), ability to give alms, and interactions suggesting neither poverty nor wealth.
